title: Yao Lee, singer known as the ‘Silver Voice’ who fused Chinese folk forms with jazz rhythms – obituary
text:
Yao Lee, also known as Yao Li, who has died aged 96, was a singer known as the “Silver Voice”, one of the “Seven Great Singing Stars of Shanghai”; hugely prolific, with a soft, lilting delivery, she is thought to have made more than 400 records.

She was heard as recently as last year, when her 1959 song Ren Sheng Jiu Shi Xi (Life is Just a Play) was used on the soundtrack to the hit romcom Crazy Rich Asians.

She was born Yiu Sau Wan on September 3 1922 and brought up in Shanghai; her brother was the equally celebrated singer and songwriter Yao Min, with whom she often performed.
